data.question: What is the difference between == and .equals() in Java ?
Which of the following is true about ArrayList and LinkedList ?

choices.1: ArrayList is faster for insertions and deletions compared to LinkedList
choices.3: ArrayList provides fast random access, while LinkedList is better for frequent insertions/deletions
choices.4: LinkedList consumes less memory than ArrayList

data.question: How does Java handle memory management ?

choices.1: Developers need to manually allocate and free memory
choices.2: Java has automatic garbage collection for managing memory
choices.3: Java does not have any garbage collection mechanism
choices.4: Java uses delete and free functions for memory management

data.question: Which of the following is true about checked and unchecked exceptions ?

choices.1: Checked exceptions are checked at compile-time, unchecked exceptions at runtime
choices.2: Unchecked exceptions are checked at compile-time, checked exceptions at runtime
choices.3: Both checked and unchecked exceptions are checked at runtime
choices.4: Java does not have checked exceptions

data.question: What does the volatile keyword do in Java ?

choices.1: It makes a variable thread-safe by preventing caching in CPU registers
choices.2: It prevents multiple threads from accessing a variable
choices.3: It locks the object for synchronization
